item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Riddlers Club Answers
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find Sam Of The Riddlers Club In Zenless Zone Zero
  • Riddlers’ Club Part 1 Answer
  • Riddlers’ Club Part 2 Answer
  • Riddlers’ Club Part 3

Once players have completed the Main Quest Chapter 2 - Interlude, they will have gained access to the third area in Zenless Zone Zero : Lumina Square. Lumina Square is the bustling metropolitan sector of New Eridu.

After players unlock Officer Mewmew in Zenless Zone Zero , they can start playing through the game to get all the medals that he gives out. One of these medals relates to the Riddlers Club, a side mission that players can find when speaking to the NPC Sam. Players will need to answer his riddles correctly to proceed through each one and get all the rewards.

Where To Find Sam Of The Riddlers Club In Zenless Zone Zero

Near the pedestrian area, you will be able to find Sam underneath a palm tree opposite the newsstand . This is to the right of the parking lot when you leave. He’ll be there in the morning and afternoon , so just speak to him to start the quest.

Riddlers’ Club Part 1 Answer

Here is the riddle and the answer to it:

Riddle: An ineffable creation of silver, beautiful and smooth, brought together by fate.
Answer: The large silver artwork in the middle of Lumina Square

There are many silver artworks in Lumina Square. Players need to head to the sculpture that’s near Chop Junior’s Noodle Shop. Before you take the picture with your camera, make sure the button says target spotted . That’s your indication that you’re at the right one. Head back to Sam to give him the picture and you’ll have completed the mission. You can then head to Officer Mewmew to collect the medal as well.

Riddlers’ Club Part 2 Answer

After completing the first mission, the second part will automatically unlock the next day, in the morning . However, there has been an incident where some players needed to complete some other random commissions before Sam’s Riddlers Club one will pop up again. This could also be a level lock issue, so if it doesn’t show up for you, give it some time and check in again after a couple of commissions.

Riddle: Yin and Yang, black and white… Two fantasy creatures, chasing each other's tail.
Answer: The dual dragon painting on the wall of the parking lot.

The painting is actually a little way behind Sam, so run to the other side, snap a picture of the dragons and head back to Sam. The second part is now complete, and you can go to Officer Mewmew to collect the medal.

Riddlers’ Club Part 3

Riddlers Club Part 3 is pretty straightforward and may also only unlock after a couple of in-game days. Keep an eye out for the ‘Curious Passerby’, who is an elderly NPC located opposite from where Sam was. Speak to her to trigger the mission, and then you’ll be able to talk to Marcel BB07 who has now taken Sam’s place.

Once you’re done, the quest series is over, and you can head over to Officer Mewmew to collect the final medal.

item.title: Ace Attorney: 7 Most Evil Characters, Ranked
item.description:
The Ace Attorney franchise thrives on the strength of its story and characters. Each murder mystery comes with twists and turns, as well as a cast of highly memorable witnesses, defendants, and victims. But in this courtroom dramedy of truth versus lies, it’s the true culprit that usually takes center stage.

Ace Attorney villains run the gambit of motivations and morality. Some of them are sympathetic characters who commit crimes out of fear or necessity. Most, however, are purely selfish criminals who frame innocent people for their despicable crimes. But of all the murderers this 23-year-old franchise has seen, these culprits stand out as the most heinous.

7 Kristoph Gavin

The Devil You Know

While the Apollo Justice game left fans divided, no one can deny it opened up with one heck of a plot twist. The titular Apollo’s own mentor, Kristoph Gavin, initially comes across like Mia Fey from the original trilogy, before it’s revealed that he was actually the real murderer.

It only gets worse from there. The game’s final case delves into even more vile deeds Kristoph committed for the sake of his own pride and reputation. He’d do anything to cover his tracks, too, even plotting to murder a 13-year-old girl. Plenty of Ace Attorney characters are killers, but child murder has, until now, been a step too far for most.

6 Queen Ga’ran Sigatar Khura’in

One Slippery Sovereign

This queen of Khura’in isn’t just above the law: she is the law. Her decrees are gospel the moment they’re written down. Throughout Spirit of Justice , players discover all the murderous deeds Queen Ga’ran did to gain her unchecked power, and what she’s willing to do in order to keep it.

Her husband isn’t much better off, but even he has the redeeming quality of genuinely loving their adoptive daughter, Princess Rayfa. Not Queen Ga’ran, though. Family means nothing to this tyrant. All she cares about is her own power.

5 The Phantom

Gaze Into The Endless Abyss

Unlike other two-faced villains in the series, players never learn the true identity of this international spy. Simply put: there is no “real” identity to be had. The criminal known only as “The Phantom” cast aside their identity years ago, forgetting themselves so they could carry out their work.

That “work” in question also happens to include murder and international terrorism, by the way. The Phantom rigged a spacecraft to explode and, to cover up his tracks, murdered a mother right before her child’s eyes. That child, a young Athena Cykes, may have been his next victim as well if she hadn’t fought back. The Phantom feels nothing for the evils he’s committed, too. He’d do it all again if it meant completing his mission.

4 Redd White

He Deserves Being Beaten Red, Black, and Blue

Redd White of Bluecorp is a man who’s made millions blackmailing hundreds of people. His company is built on finding the dirt on rich, powerful people and lording their dirty deeds over their heads. His rotten business has destroyed countless lives, including that of Mia and Maya’s mother, Misty Fey.

Mia tried valiantly to bring White to justice, only for him to murder her, leaving Wright without a mentor and Maya without her sister. He’s a man who, by his own admission, lives solely for personal profit. He even has the gall to be arrogant about his own greatness, knowing full well the suffering he’s inflicted.

3 Matt Engarge

Soulless and Two-Faced

Matt Engarge first appears to be an air-headed pretty boy celebrity, the kind of multimillionaire actor who seems nice enough, albeit utterly disconnected from reality. In truth, this friendly facade is just part of his acting.

Underneath it all, Matt Engarde is a complete monster who drove an innocent woman past the brink of despair, then ordered a hit on his biggest rival. He’s the ultimate example of celebrity corruption: a rich man who values his reputation over anything and everything. He truly cares for no one but himself, viewing everyone around him as tools to use and throw away.

2 Manfred von Karma

The OG Baddie Of The Entire Series

If Miles Edgeworth was once known as the “Demon Prosecutor,” then Manfred von Karma is the devil himself. This absolute terror of a man has convicted every defendant he’s ever prosecuted in his 40-year-long career. His methods of obtaining these verdicts range from ruthless to illegal, all to meet his twisted ideals of “perfection.”

When Miles’s father, Gregory Edgeworth, even scratched this man’s flawless record, Manfred’s payback was absolutely devastating. His actions ended up having a snowball effect on the rest of the series’ story, ruining the lives of multiple characters. His name is synonymous with fear. Even his own hero-worshipping daughter has very little real love for him (and vice versa).

1 Dahlia Hawthorne

People Are Not Always Who They Appear To Be

Dahlia Hawthorne may be beautiful, but players better not let that fool them. This woman’s angelic appearance hides a true demon inside, an utterly remorseless killer with the highest body count of any Ace Attorney culprit. She’s poisoned, stabbed, and manipulated her way through crime after crime, all with a sickeningly sweet smile plastered on her face.

And while other Ace Attorney villains only had ill intentions towards specific people, or were corrupted by power, Dahlia has no excuse for her behavior. Sure, her upbringing wasn’t easy, but her crime spree began as early as 14 years old. By her own admission, she’s always been a demon. Even death couldn’t contain Dahlia Hawthorne’s evil forever.

item.title: Once Human: How To Get Starchrom
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is Starchrom?
  • How To Get Starchrom

Once Human is setting itself up to be one of the biggest free-to-play survival games, featuring a vast open world where players can build their own territory and scavenge for resources and items to boost their survivability. While most players will focus on grabbing the essentials like food and water, along with crafting the most basic weapons and equipment, players looking to take on the toughest Monolith bosses will need to get their hands on some of the best weapons in the game.

Weapon and armor Blueprints are the most surefire way for players to increase both their firepower and defense in Once Human . Though these items can be acquired through simple looting, the best weapons and gear are often acquired through the Wish Machine. However, to use this unique facility, players will need an ample supply of Starchrom. Here is how to get Starchrom in Once Human .

What Is Starchrom?

Starchrom is a special currency in Once Human that is tied to the Wish Machine. The Wish Machine is a Function Facility that players can have within their territory that offers players the opportunity to obtain Blueprints needed to craft weapons and armor. Players looking to use their Starchrom on the Wish Machine can do one of the following: press F to Make a Wish when within the Wish Machine's proximity, or press G to head to the Blueprint Shop .

Those who press F will be taken into the Wish Machine, where they gamble their Starchrom to earn special prizes . From here, players can select one of the different reward pools at the bottom of the screen. Once players have selected their desired prize pool, they can then press 'Play' to partake in a whack-a-mole-style minigame to earn Blueprints. Each successful whack will cost Starchrom , and players can play until they have either exhausted their Starchrom, or can simply back out whenever they want.

Each prize pool will reset once it has been emptied (except for The Long-Awaited pool), but it can also be reset manually once players acquire the S-Tier reward of each pool. The number of potential rewards in each prize pool will also differ, meaning the maximum amount of Starchrom a player can spend on each game will vary. For example, those who want to claim all 10 rewards for The Long-Awaited pool can spend up to 1,000 Starchrom.

Alternatively, those who head to the Blueprint Shop can simply choose exactly what they want to spend their Starchrom on . The Blueprint Shop is the better option for players who want to avoid gambling their hard-earned Starchrom, but the cost of obtaining blueprints this way is much higher.

How To Get Starchrom

Seasonal Goals

The first way that players can acquire Starchrom is by completing Seasonal Goals . Seasonal Goals are essentially challenges that are each split into different phases for each season . These challenges will reward players with Mitsuko's Mark upon completion, but will also fill the progress bar needed to acquire the Seasonal Goal rewards for each Seasonal Phase. Three total reward tiers can be acquired for each Seasonal Phase, each of which contains Starchrom . For players looking to access their Season Goals, they can do the following:

  • Press ESC to open up the map menu.
  • Head on over to the current season's scenario.
  • Head to the Seasonal Goals tab and select any one of the Seasonal Phases.

From here, players can simply view and track the challenges they have available , head on over to the Seasonal Shop, or claim their Seasonal Goal rewards.

Stardust Resonator Filter

While most other methods only offer players a limited supply of Starchrom, players can actually farm this currency through the Stardust Resonator Filter . The Stardust Resonator Filter allows players to refine Eclipse Cortex into Starchrom , but doing so comes at a price. Purifying Eclipse Cortex will require players to defend the Stardust Resonator Filter for the duration that the purification process is active. Both the time that players will have to defend the area, and the intensity of enemies they face, will depend on the amount and level of the Eclipse Cortex placed into the Stardust Resonator Filter. Players can build the Stardust Resonator Filter with the following:

  • 20 Glass
  • 30 Metal Scraps
  • 20 Rubber
  • 10 Copper Ingot
  • 10 Acid

For those looking to acquire Eclipse Cortex , the best methods include completing side Tasks and activating Production Facilities — each of which can be found on the map.

There is a weekly purification limit on the Stardust Resonator Filter, meaning that players can only generate a limited amount of Starchrom each week.

Stellar Planula Shop

Starchrom, like Stardust Source, can also be obtained from Merchants. Starchrom in particular can be purchased from Severin VII-S2041 for 100 Stellar Planula — acquired through completing Morphic Hunt events or side Tasks. Severin VII-S2041 will first be encountered at Deadsville, but can also be found in most Settlements on the map.

Prime War

Another way that players can earn Starchrom is through participating in a Prime War . A Prime War is a public event that can be found on the map and will require players to defend a Staroid Restrainer from an Original Entity Kin . Activating the Staroid Restrainer and the Prime War event will require Staroid , which can be acquired through completing Commissions. Upon activation, everyone within the Prime War area will have a short amount of time to fortify the Staroid Restrainer before the Original Entity Kin arrives. Once the boss appears, players must defeat it while simultaneously defending the Staroid Restrainer.

The Original Entity Kin is quite difficult to take down, as it boasts Silver Plague protection that nullifies most incoming damage. The best way to disable this protective barrier is through the use of explosives, Plasma Rounds, and Gatling Cannons. Once the boss's Silver Plague protection is removed, it will be more susceptible to standard weaponry. Defeating the Original Entity Kin for the first round will yield a hefty Starchrom reward , but players can also obtain Stardust's Advent by participating in the same Prime War once it's available again after a 10-minute cooldown.

Be sure to play with friends or members of your Hive to increase the likelihood of taking down the Original Entity Kin.

Battle Pass

Following the trend of earning Starchrom, the highly sought-after currency can also be obtained through the Battle Pass . Though the Battle Pass does offer cosmetic rewards at a premium price, the free pass offers various resources that players can obtain without spending any money. One of these rewards just so happens to be Starchrom. Players can level up the Once Human Battle Pass wth EXP earned by completing in-game tasks. Once players reach a certain tier that includes Starchrom, they can claim it through the Battle Pass menu. To access the Battle Pass, players can do the following:

  • Open up the main menu by pressing the ESC key.
  • Navigate over to Shop Events.
  • Head on over to the Battle Pass tab.

Journey

Another way to acquire a regular supply of Starchrom is by progressing through the Once Human Journey . The Journey is essentially a collection of different tasks that players can complete to obtain a series of rewards. Each task in a Journey yields its own rewards, but only by completing all the tasks within each Journey will players be able to claim Starchrom. Players can view their Journey tasks and claim Journey rewards by pressing the J key to open up the Journey menu.

Events

Much like many other rewards, Starchrom can also be obtained through in-game events . Events in Once Human are ever-changing and though some are permanent, others are only available for a limited time. To view the events for Once Human , players can head to the Events tab of the Shop Events portion of the main menu . From here, players can simply view the tasks they need to complete to claim event rewards, or simply claim their rewards upon fulfilling a task.

Completing The Once Human Survey

The final method to acquire a nice supply of Starchrom is to complete the Once Human survey . While this method only offers a one-time reward of 300 Starchrom, completing it is quick and easy. To gain access to the survey, players can simply open up the main menu and select the Survey with Reward 1 tab at the bottom right of the screen. From here, players can simply fill out the survey to claim their Starchrom reward.

There are bound to be additional Once Human surveys to complete in the future, so be sure to keep an eye out to secure even more survey rewards.

item.title: The Legend Of Heroes: Trails Through Daybreak - Best Playable Characters, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Feri Al-Fayed offers increased damage and CP regeneration, making her a valuable addition early on in Chapter 1.
  • Judith Lanster can farm additional Sepith and charm foes with unique status effects, adding versatility in battle.
  • Bergard Zeman, a veteran martial arts master with debuffing capabilities, joins late but brings incredible damage output.

The Legend of Heroes: Trails Through Daybreak is the first game in the long-running Trails series' Calvard arc, taking fans of the franchise from the familiar environs of the Erebonian Empire to a brand-new part of Zemuria. Though the game initially came out several years ago in Japan, fans in the west have celebrated the game being localized in English.

Trails Through Daybreak features many playable characters, a number of which are either temporary guests or only join the party after a certain choice has been made late in the game. The main cast is formed by the eight employees of Arkride Solutions, and they are the only ones the player may freely use or customize as they please. For those curious, here are the best playable characters in The Legend of Heroes: Trails Through Daybreak .

8 Ferida "Feri" Al-Fayed

Offers Increased Damage And CP Regeneration

  • Joins in Chapter 1

Ferida Al-Fayed (also known as "Feri") is a member of the Warriors of Kruga, a Central Eastern Jaeger corps. She joins Arkride Solutions in order to broaden her horizons, and though she is young and innocent to the ways of the world, she is still an experienced fighter.

Feri's main utility in battle generally lies in her high speed and crafts, which can debuff her targets with effects like Slow or RES/ARES Down. Her most useful craft is her buff, Flaming Prayer, which grants both increased damage and CP regeneration. However, her lack of specialization in either physical or arts damage can narrow her utility in tough boss battles.

7 Judith Lanster

Can Farm Additional Sepith

  • Introduced in Chapter 2, joins in Intermission

Judith Lanster is one of the hottest actresses in Calvard, recently appearing in Director Salvatore Gotti's Golden Blood . Her status as an actress, however, is a cover for her secret identity, which she dons in the darkness of the night.

Judith has a relatively unconventional moveset, with unique status effects like Bewitch, which can charm foes into assisting her. She can use Swift Larceny to farm extra sepith from monsters and can be both an effective physical attacker or arts caster. However, she can fall short when it comes to characters who can specialize in one type of damage.

6 Bergard Zeman

A Veteran Martial Arts Master With Debuffing Capabilities

  • Joins in Chapter 5

Bergard Zeman is the last permanent party member to join Arkride Solutions, and he is also the oldest playable character in the game. A master martial artist from the unique Kunlun school, Bergard has had many different disciples over the course of his long life, with Van being one of them.

Bergard is mainly a physical attacker with many powerful crafts that make him a juggernaut in battle. He can cancel arts with Lion's Roar and debuff defense with King of the Beasts. Unfortunately, he is really only available during the late-game, but his incredible damage more than makes up for it.

5 Aaron Wei

A Great Crowd Control Option

  • Joins in Chapter 2

Aaron Wei is a young man living in the city of Langport, where he was born and raised surrounded by beloved friends and family. A charismatic leader who is beloved by everyone he comes across, Aaron may be arrogant and hot-headed, but he'll defend his city with his life.

Aaron Wei is a powerful physical attacker with a variety of crafts that demonstrate his offensive power. Myriad Slashes is a great crowd control tool that can delay enemies, and Falcon Talons is powerful enough to deal damage equal to an S-Craft given the right setups. Aaron can even boost his damage further with Bawanggong, which increases his damage depending on how low his HP is.

4 Quatre Salision

A Diligent Academic Who Offers Great Support

  • Joins in Chapter 4

Quatre Salision is a researcher at the Basel Institute of Science, where Calvard's most cutting-edge research takes place. A student under the legendary Professor Latoya Hamilton, Quatre is dedicated to protecting his master's philosophies while pursuing his own studies.

Quatre is the second major arts caster among the main cast, with his damage output easily rivaling Agnes's. His crafts aren't anything to sneeze at either, with powerful support crafts like Laplace Code, which can drop damage-absorbing shields, and Satellite Cure, which can restore HP and CP, making him a battery for CP-hungry characters.

3 Risette Twinings

A Resourceful Concierge Who Can Protect Allies

  • Joins in Chapter 3

Risette Twinings is an employee of the Marduk Total Security Company, and the main point of contact between the company and Van. Calling herself a concierge, Risette does her best to attend to his needs, especially after becoming an employee of Arkride Solutions.

Risette is capable of both dealing physical damage and arts damage, but her most useful utility lies in her support craft, Cobalt Curtain, which grants shields to all allies in a large area while also raising their defenses. With a low CP cost on top of all that, this makes Risette a must-have for setting up emergency shields, especially when battling against bosses with S-crafts.

2 Agnes Claudel

An Heiress Who Can Revive Fallen Comrades

  • Joins in the Prologue

A student at Aramis Academy, Agnes Claudel kickstarts the events of Trails Through Daybreak when she enlists Van's help in tracking down a lost family heirloom. This search eventually compels her to join Arkride Solutions in order to find the others.

Agnes is the first arts caster available to the player and a potent one as well. While she has healing and shield crafts, her best asset is her S-craft, Brilliant Halo, which can revive and fully heal all allies. This makes Agnes capable of overturning a dire situation in a single move, resulting in her being invaluable.

1 Van Arkride

A Spriggan Who Serves As A Reliable Tank

  • Joins in the Prologue (Main Character)

The lone proprietor of Arkride Solutions, Van Arkride performs work as a 'spriggan,' doing the kind of jobs that couldn't be brought to the police and the bracer guild. While the jobs he receives sometimes skirt the law, he always does his best to fulfill the client's wishes.

As the main protagonist, Van is naturally very effective in battle. A strong physical attacker with powerful crafts like Aerial Buster and Stun Slash, his most unique and vital craft is Coin Bullets, which lets him act as a tank to draw enemy attention, allowing the rest of the party to move as they please.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Officer Mewmew Missions In Brant Street Construction Site
item.description:
Zenless Zone Zero has many different ways in which players can collect rewards. Through exploration missions, combat missions, and side ones with puzzles, Zenless Zone Zero players have an ample number of opportunities. An additional gameplay mode that players can enjoy is the Officer Mewmew Missions.

Officer Mewmew is a cat police officer that can be found in all areas once unlocked. Once players have progressed through the story, which includes the Belobog Heavy Industries Faction, and unlocked Brant Street Construction Site, only then will they be able to unlock the Officer Mewmew Missions. They should also keep in mind that most of these missions are pretty haphazard and spread across different timings and levels. Just make sure to keep an eye out for one when you do see it.

Brant Street Construction Site Mewmew Medals

Medal Mission Location How To Complete
Keen Senses Medal Find all the lost cargo trucks Around Brant Street Construction Site This mission is relatively easy as all you need to do is find the missing 4 cargo trucks.
Kind Helper Medal I Complete the mission “Cement Mixer Modification Manual” Daytime (Afternoon): Near the white cement truck. Speak to Kousaka near the white cement truck to receive this mission. You can just follow the game’s navigation to complete it.
Kind Helper Medal II Complete the mission “Hands and the Art of Cement” Daytime (Morning): Near the white cement truck This will be immediately available after the previous quest once you rest. Check your phone for a message from Kousaka and then just add the commission to your schedule. In this order, speak to Kousaka, Grace, take a photo of Enzo and then speak to the white cement. Choose the option: “Calm down, little one!”
Kind Helper Medal III Complete the mission “Almighty Safety Helmet” Daytime (Morning): Near the cement pipes Speak to Ironhead near the cement pipes and just follow the navigation to complete it. You need to speak to 3 NPCs who have the star icon above their heads.
Kind Helper Medal IV Complete the mission “Bro-to-Bro Communication” Daytime (Afternoon): Find Anton near the forklift. Keep in mind this is only available at Level 33. Speak to Anton and then head to Sixth Street to take a picture of a cool car. The car will be behind the alley between the Coff Café and General Chop’s Noodle Shop. Take a picture and text it to Anton to complete the mission.
Kind Helper Medal V Complete the mission “The Missing Drivers” Daytime (Afternoon): Near the life under the site. Speak to Foreman Thomas and just follow the navigation to complete the quest.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal I Help a Bangboo Daytime (Morning): Near the wooden boxes behind Officer Mewmew Find Broboo and help solve its problem.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal II Help a Bangboo Daytime (Afternoon): On the platform near the wooden crates . Find Challengerboo and simply talk to it to complete the mission.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal III Help a Bangboo Daytime (Evening): Right next to the dirt pit Find Catloverboo and speak to it to complete the mission.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal IV Help a Bangboo Nighttime (Midnight): Near the white cement truck Find Survivalistboo and speak to it to receive the medal.
Timely Assistance Medal I Help a Bangboo Daytime (Morning): On the raised platform beside the orange containers
  1. Find Complaint Bangboo seated and help fix its module.
  2. Rotate the left middle socket twice so that the yellow side is facing down.
  3. Rotate the right middle socket thrice so that the blue side is connected to complete it.
Timely Assistance Medal II Help a Bangboo Daytime (Afternoon): Under a notice board near the forklift parallel to Officer Mewmew
  1. Find Safety and fix its module
  2. Rotate the left middle socket thrice so that the yellow side is facing downwards, and the blue connects up to unlock the bottom left.
  3. Rotate the top left socket, so the blue side faces down.
  4. Then, rotate the bottom two right sockets so that they face 90 degrees to each other.
  5. Once the top right socket unlocks , rotate it once
  6. Then, rotate the top right one so that the blue side is facing right to connect everything.
Timely Assistance Medal III Help a Bangboo Daytime (Evening): Near the dirt pit ( opposite the Junction Box )
  1. Find Alphaboo and connect its module
  2. Rotate the top left socket once so that the blue side faces down.
  3. Rotate the top right socket once , the middle right socket twice.
  4. Rotate the middle (centermost) socket twice, so the blue side is facing down
  5. Then, rotate the bottom middle socket twice to face left to complete it.
Timely Assistance Medal IV Help a Bangboo Nighttime (Midnight): Beside the cement pipes
  1. Find Hollerboo and fix its module
  2. Rotate the left middle socket once so that the blue side is facing right.
  3. Rotate the bottom left socket thrice so that it faces right
  4. Then, rotate the bottom right socket thrice and the top right socket once to connect everything.
Silver Talent Seeker Medal Collect half of the HIA Commemorative Coins in Brant Street Construction Site Around Brant Street Construction Site During various hours of the day, speak to NPCs to receive the HIA Coins in the area. There are 5 you need to find to get this medal.
Gold Talent Seeker Medal Collect all HIA Commemorative Coins In Brant Street Construction Site Around Brant Street Construction Site Find all 10 HIA Coins in the area. Look out for the NPCs with ellipse bubbles over their heads.
